title.value: DynGFN: Towards Bayesian Inference of Gene Regulatory Networks with GFlowNets
title.justification: This information is found at the very beginning of the paper.
title.quote: DynGFN: Towards Bayesian Inference of Gene Regulatory Networks with GFlowNets

extractions.description: This paper introduces DynGFN, a novel framework for Bayesian structure learning in dynamical systems, tailored for modeling posteriors over cyclic graphs. The method leverages Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) and RNA velocity techniques to better capture the uncertainty and cyclic nature of gene regulatory networks (GRNs). The authors propose a per-node factorization within DynGFN and highlight its efficacy through empirical evaluations on synthetic data and real single-cell RNA-velocity data.

type.justification: The paper conducts empirical evaluations on synthetic dynamic data and real biological data to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.
type.quote: We empirically evaluated DynGFN on synthetic dynamic data designed to induce highly multimodal posteriors over graphs. We showcase the use of DynGFN on a real biological system using single-cell RNA-velocity data for learning posteriors of GRNs.

name.justification: The paper focuses on inferring gene regulatory networks, a key problem in computational biology, using advanced machine learning techniques.
name.quote: Inferring gene regulatory networks (GRNs) is a long standing problem in cell biology.

name.justification: The paper proposes a Bayesian structure learning framework, focusing on modeling posteriors over possible structures.
name.quote: We consider this as a problem of Bayesian structure learning from continuous dynamics â€“ we term this Bayesian dynamic structure learning.

name.justification: The paper leverages Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) to model distributions over cyclic graphs.
name.quote: Our approach leverages Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) to model complex distributions over cyclic structures.

name.justification: The paper treats gene regulatory networks and their inference as a problem of sparse identification of a dynamical system.
name.quote: To accomplish this, we treat structure learning as a problem of sparse identification of a dynamical system.

name.justification: The primary contribution of the paper is the DynGFN model, designed for Bayesian dynamic structure learning.
name.quote: We design a novel GFlowNet architecture, Dynamic GFlowNet (DynGFN), tailored for modelling posteriors over cyclic structures.

is_contributed.justification: The primary contribution of the paper is the DynGFN model, designed for Bayesian dynamic structure learning.
is_contributed.quote: We design a novel GFlowNet architecture, Dynamic GFlowNet (DynGFN), tailored for modelling posteriors over cyclic structures.

is_executed.justification: The model was implemented and executed in the experiments conducted in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We empirically evaluated DynGFN on synthetic dynamic data... We showcase the use of DynGFN on a real biological system using single-cell RNA-velocity data for learning posteriors of GRNs.

is_compared.justification: DynGFN was compared to other models such as BCD-Nets and DiBS in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: In this section we evaluate the performance of DynGFN against counterpart Bayesian structure learning methods

referenced_paper_title.justification: As the model is introduced in this paper, there is no previously referenced paper for it.

name.justification: The synthetic dynamic data was generated for the purpose of this paper's experiments.
name.quote: We empirically evaluated DynGFN on synthetic dynamic data designed to induce highly multimodal posteriors over graphs.

referenced_paper_title.quote: We empirically evaluated DynGFN on synthetic dynamic data designed to induce highly multimodal posteriors over graphs.

name.justification: The paper references the dataset used from a specific single-cell RNA-velocity data research.
name.quote: We showcase the use of DynGFN on a real biological system using single-cell RNA-velocity data for learning posteriors of GRNs. Further details for this experimental set-up are provided in Appendix C.1.3. [46]

referenced_paper_title.value: Cell cycle gene regulation dynamics revealed by RNA velocity and deep-learning.

name.justification: PyTorch is mentioned as the implementation framework used for the models in the paper.
name.quote: Our model is implemented in Pytorch and Pytorch Lightning and is available at https://github. com/lazaratan/dyn-gfn.
